function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Rapidly evolving knowledge in the field of pandemic planning and urban connections.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of effective screening criteria leads to inclusion of irrelevant articles","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exclusion of relevant articles based on abstract and title screening","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exclusion of relevant articles during data extraction","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global monitoring of 2.1 billion people in sewage treatment plants","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in the information gleaned from monitoring for sars-cov-2 rna in wastewater","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential bias in wastewater temperature as a source of data bias in wastewater-based epidemiology","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Estimation of initial sars-cov-2 loads and persistence in wastewater","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of contagious diseases through wastewater collection system","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Estimation of wastewater loading and population density could result in inaccurate representation of actual wastewater flows and population exposure to contaminants.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variation in per-assay costs of clinical and wbe screening due to geospatial differences and labor costs.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High sars-cov-2 load in wastewater, leading to elevated concentrations of viral genomes.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient information on virus shedding by symptomatic and asymptomatic individuals","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neglecting the impact of temperature on degradation of biomarkers in wastewater can lead to error propagation into estimates of upstream discharge, consumption, exposure, and excretion.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Wastewater-based epidemiology wbe studies that do not adjust monitoring results to temperature risk significant under- or over-estimation of the true temporal changes occurring in virus shedding within the community.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global wastewater temperature modeling can help in predicting the impact of temperature on the degradation of biomarkers in wastewater, providing a basis for informed decision-making in public health responses.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Underestimation of covid-19 prevalence due to seasonal temperature changes and wastewater temperatures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misinterpretation of stable case load due to temperature changes not being accounted for","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changing population focus for wastewater-based epidemiology wbe observations due to seasonal temperature changes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limitations of wastewater sampling in reflecting the health status of the population","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Practicability and cost considerations of clinical testing and wastewater-based epidemiology wbe","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate testing capacity for a nation’s population may lead to slow and incomplete assessment of infection status, allowing for undetected spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High cost of individual clinical testing for large populations may limit the frequency and scope of testing, leading to delayed or incomplete identification of infected individuals.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited clinical testing capacity compared to population size may result in slow and costly screening processes, hindering effective assessment and management of contagious disease spread.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate detection limit and precision of quantitative data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Logistical challenges and costs of wbe approach","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited access to wbe for certain regions and populations","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Desire to keep required sample sizes low for economic shipping.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in obtaining data on the infectivity of sewage-borne sars-cov-2.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Wastewater-based epidemiology wbe may not fully replace clinical testing for covid-19 and may need to be used in conjunction with clinical testing.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limitations in global access to centrally collected wastewater for wbe may restrict its effectiveness in certain regions.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Diverting resources from clinical testing to wbe may affect the accuracy and timeliness of covid-19 surveillance and response.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Financial interests in startup companies related to the study’s intellectual space","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Founding a nonprofit project providing wastewater-based health assessments","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Disintegrated and non-interoperable data inhibits computer-assisted reasoning, hindering artificial intelligence.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on ontologies for data standardization and knowledge representation poses a single point of failure risk.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Propagation of contagious diseases through data sharing and integration","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of biomedical ontologies for studying coronavirus diseases","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of interoperability between ontologies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate representation of coronavirus infectious diseases in cido","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Interoperability with over 300 other ontologies increases the risk of propagating inaccuracies and inconsistencies in disease data.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Development of cido-specific terms for covid-19 and other coronavirus diseases may lead to discrepancies in terminology and classification with existing ontologies.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Logical axioms and relations within the ontology may introduce errors or biases in representing disease processes and causation.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Infection with sars-cov-2 leading to the development of covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Identification of drugs with potential anti-coronavirus effects","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of ontology-based integration and analysis of anti-coronavirus drugs","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unregulated promotion of drugs based on information extracted from ontologies","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incomplete coverage of drug information in existing ontologies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient representation of vaccine information in ontologies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of misinformation due to incomplete ontology-based approaches","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"}]}
